intro: Jumellea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved jumellea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often arranged in pairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Jumellea angustifolia is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, which helps improve soil fertility.
